The **wand of sonics** is a new wand introduced in [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") and adapted by [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). This wand shoots a reflectable [ray](/wiki/Ray "Ray") of sonic noise.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Identification](#Identification)
- [2 Effects](#Effects)
- [3 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)
- [4 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [5 Messages](#Messages)
- [6 References](#References)

## Identification

This wand will [auto-identify](/wiki/Auto-identify "Auto-identify") on zapping or [engraving](/wiki/Engraving "Engraving"). Engraving will also wake nearby monsters since the wand emits loud noises.

## Effects

This wand shares some traits with the [wand of striking](/wiki/Wand_of_striking "Wand of striking") in that it will break [boulders](/wiki/Boulder "Boulder") and [statues](/wiki/Statue "Statue").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) [Glass golems](/wiki/Glass_golem "Glass golem") hit by the sonic ray are instakilled. The sonic ray will also destroy [doors](/wiki/Door "Door").

Sonic rays also tend to destroy [glass](/wiki/Glass "Glass") items, if you are zapped, you zap a monster, or you break the wand.

Breaking this wand results in a sonic explosion that deals (4 x 4 x charges remaining) sonic damage, possibly destroying your [glass](/wiki/Glass "Glass") items.

Monsters will also be happy to zap you with this wand.

Zapping yourself will inflict 6d6 sonic damage and make you [deaf](/wiki/Deaf "Deaf") for 100-399 turns, [\[2\]](#cite_note-2) and possibly shatter any glass items you are carrying. If you have [sonic resistance](/index.php?title=Sonic_resistance\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Sonic resistance (page does not exist)") you will be protected from the damage but not the item destruction.

## Hack'EM

| /               |                                                                                 |
| --------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name            | noise                                                                           |
| Appearance      | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance")                   |
| Base price      | 175 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                                               |
| Weight          | 7                                                                               |
| Type            | ray                                                                             |
| Maximum charges | 8                                                                               |
| Monster use     | *May be used [offensively](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item") by monsters.* |

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), the **wand of sonics** was renamed to the **wand of noise**. Breaking this wand deals (4 x charges remaining x 4) damage and has a chance of creating a [magic beam trap](/index.php?title=Magic_beam_trap\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Magic beam trap (page does not exist)") depending on how many charges were left.

The wand itself has been made immune to shattering from sonic damage (if it happens to be made of glass).

In addition to destroying doors, a sonic ray can destroy [drawbridges](/wiki/Drawbridge "Drawbridge"), [iron bars](/wiki/Iron_bars "Iron bars"), and [toilets](/wiki/Toilet "Toilet"). When the toilet is shattered, it leaves a [fountain](/wiki/Fountain "Fountain") in it's place. When the iron bars are shattered, it will scatter a couple [iron chains](/wiki/Iron_chain "Iron chain").

## Strategy

This wand is quite strong because very few monsters resist sonic damage in [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"). In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM") any monster that has a sonic attack has built-in [sonic resistance](/index.php?title=Sonic_resistance\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Sonic resistance (page does not exist)"), as well as all [dragons](/wiki/Dragons "Dragons") and [elementals](/wiki/Elemental "Elemental"). This still leaves the vast majority of monsters vulnerable to this damage type. The downside is that any glass items in the monster's possession are susceptible to shattering and you might waste a valuable potion, ring, or wand by accident.

Since iron chains are desirable for forging certain items in Hack'EM (ie: [bullets](/wiki/Bullet "Bullet"), [firearms](/wiki/Firearms "Firearms"), or [spiked chains](/wiki/Spiked_chain "Spiked chain")), this wand may be useful for farming iron bars for their resulting chains.

## Messages

- The wand issues a series of loud bangs!

  You engraved while not deaf.

- KABOOM! You deafen yourself!

  You zapped yourself.

- KABOOM! Well that was loud.

  You zapped yourself with sonic resistance.
